meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Tammie Taylor Jason Zaborski Nanette Wargo Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #4002.

td.p: Tammie Taylor, a college professor and antique dealer from Houston, Texas
Jason Zaborski, a defense policy analyst from Arlington, Virginia
Nanette Wargo, a graduate student from Sauk Village, Illinois (whose 1-day cash winnings total $15,430)

tr.td: LITERARY TITLE PAIRS
OSCAR ODDITIES
BATTLES
MR. EDS
WATER WORLD
"S"-ENCE

tr.td: Nanette
Jason
Tammie
SAME BIRTHDAY AS DR. KING
ALPHABET SOUP

"C" SEA
SEÑOR

Jason

toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '
TammieWho is Degas?
$4,000
NanetteWho [snowball like blob of something scribbled out] was Degas?
$10,000

$3,001
(Edgar) Degas')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'Marie von Goethem, a student of the Ballet de l\'Opera, was the model for his most famous sculpture')

tr.td: ARTISTS
Marie von Goethem, a student of the Ballet de l'Opera, was the model for his most famous sculpture
Nanette
Jason
Tammie
2-day champion: $38,430
2nd place: trip to Jamaica and stay at Beaches Ochos Rios
3rd place: trip to Rancho Mirage, California & stay at Marriott's Rancho Las Palmas Resort & Country Club
Nanette
Jason
Tammie

18 R
(including 1 DD),
2 W
(including 1 DD)

25 R
(including 1 DD),
3 W
